> We also use XML to persist information about runs, and
> we use XSL style sheets to convert the XML into SVG
> for display purposes.

This is really clever. This could easily be extended to other forms of
data rendering too... and its pretty much implementation-agnostic isn't
it? As long as you have a decent XML library.

Are the XSL style sheets included with your distribution? I've been
collecting very general snippets of code for use in NE, so that I won't
have to go through the process of reimplementing every time I want to
construct a new system.

> Yes, I agree.  Thanks for bringing this up.  Do any of
> the other NEAT implementations use XML?

I started out using XML to represent the all of the data from a single
run, but it turned out to be really bulky. I didn't even consider piping
that information directly into SVG though...


-- 

Joseph Reisinger
